features: Expandable Wheeled Carry On: This carry-on expands up to 34% for an additional 2.5 inches of expansion depth. Power Pocket stores cell phone and allows for a pass-through USB cord for on-the-go charging

Durable Construction: Made with ballistic nylon outer fabric that resists wear, moisture, dirt and abrasion. Outsider handle provides greater interior capacity and a flat interior surface for packing so clothing arrives wrinkle-free

Lifetime Guarantee: We're the only luggage company that offers an unconditional lifetime guarantee. If your bag is ever broken or damaged, we'll repair it free of charge, no proof of purchase needed, no questions asked

Explore Our Collection: We make a wide array of durable luggage including carry ons, duffels, rolling garment bags and hardside spinners, plus backpacks, briefcases, crossbody sling bags and much more
Engineered for Reality: We craft luggage for real world needs to make travel easier, with innovative handles, pockets, wheels and expansion systems for high functionality and more storage space
body.description: The ZDX 22” Carry-On Expandable Spinner offers 2.5” of expansion depth and still fits in an overhead compartment, making the difference between having to check a bag or not and saving time and money. Features such as an outside battery pocket so you can keep charging your phone, our Smartlink strap for connecting two bags and an easy-access pocket to hold items for security checkpoints are all designed to make your life on the road a lot smoother.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A truly lovely case to use
reviews.reviewText: I've been through so many cheaper cases, each time trying to convince myself that this one is going to be, well, maybe not quite as good as a B&R but close enough. I was wrong. Sometimes you just have to spend the money to get the quality. The lifetime guarantee is also a big plus. Plusses - the flat internal base (telescopic handle is on the outside) makes it really easy to pack and stops clothes from scrunching up; wheels are really smooth and solid - walked around Boston for a day with it without any issues; it looks smart and modern, unlike some of the other B&R bags; zips are strong; each pocket is really well thought through and serves its purpose. Negatives - besides the price, none. And besides black, the other colours are old fashioned. There's no lock on it (although you can add a padlock) which I thought would be an issue but actually it's always with me, so not really a problem. It expands by 3 cms all the way round which does add a surprising amount of capacity. Better than Samsonite, not as blingy as a Tumi, more understated than Rimowa. Just the best bags you can buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My very best piece of luggage!
reviews.reviewText: I love my Briggs and Riley carryon.. it’s light, compact and so solid.. it rolls so easily, csn pack so many pieces, and fits easily in overhead.. I have checked it at the gate on regional jet.. so easy to grab and be off without waiting for luggage pickup..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Don't leave the strap on your bag
reviews.reviewText: I spent a long time investigating a new suitcase. I've had a two wheeler for years, and I was leery of a four wheeler. The four wheeler works okay. One problem is that the briefcase I hang from the strap is probably a bit too long, and unless you carefully cinch it up, it can drag on the ground. But this suitcase works just fine as a two wheeler, so it's easy to adapt when necessary.As for the external strap, it is not permanently attached so it can come off more easily than I would like. My response is that I just never leave it on the bag when it is out of my possession. When I remove my briefcase, I take the strap too. This works fine.I would be happier with the bag if it had a few internal pockets along one of the sides. I'd also be happier if I could remove the internal strap on the bottom of the bag. I don't really have a use for it, but it does hold things down very well.Generally, however, I'm happy enough with the bag. I just used it on a two week international trip, and the bag presented no difficulties. The bag is a bit pricey, but it is well made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better width deep length
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy confortable easy to pack and carry

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The little compartments are so versatile. The big one in the front is perfect for a folded shirt and the size is perfect for hand luggage. Expands considerably too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As a flight attendant, I have always used Travelpro. I was hesitant to purchase the Briggs and Riley due to the price, but then I thought I'd never know unless I tried. Well, this is by far the best work suitcase I have owned. It glides so smooth through the airport and on sidewalks. Even fully packed, it is light, which is so important to me. My shoulders usually hurt from pushing, pulling, and lifting my bag all the time. I look at this as an investment in making my life easier. If you're on the fence, don't hesitate. You won't regret it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Splurge, you'll be glad you did.
reviews.reviewText: I hesitated for weeks on buying this. I've never spent this much money on a suitcase. But since I travel internationally for a living, and I've decided to make the shift and solely travel with a carry-on, finally- I went for it, and I'm so glad I did. Great suitcase. Handles well and comfortably. I love that the extra room zipper goes across the middle rather than adding a couple of inches to one side of the bag as other suitcases do.And my favorite is that the bars for the handle are on the outside, so they don't take up space on the inside. This makes a big difference when you're packing for longer trips.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Luggage that makes it a pleasure to travel
reviews.reviewText: This is the suitcase I was hoping to find. Expensive, but worth it.

This is my 4 or 5th piece of Briggs & Riley luggageI works for me. Right number of pocketsESP like the external handleDoesn’t take up room inside and very sturdyNever had one break yet.And best price I could find was on Amazon
